wikipedia_page.main: Guy Janion Edwards  (11 May 1881 – 30 September 1962) was an English cricketer active in 1907 who played for Essex. He was born in Kensington and died in Upper Slaughter. He appeared in two first-class matches as a righthanded batsman who scored 45 runs with a highest score of 21.He served in the Coldstream Guards in World War I and was awarded an MC in 1917.
